page.title: 17PITSFORD HILL
page.content:
Pitsford Hill isn't much of a place, you could almost drive through it without knowing it was there. It is situated at the top of a steep hill and there are several junctions just before and just after you go through the hamlet.
The hamlet is about 130' above sea level. There are a few white-walled cottages with slate roofs and a small general store / post office. We went in to ask the man about the shop and to tell him about the survey. He said that the shop isn't very busy in the winter but in July and August a surprising number of people pass through the village on their way to the north coast.
